bdsreader 0.6.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Reads selected BDS data of a person

Source: R/read_bds.R
read_bds.Rd

This function takes data from a json source, validates the contents against a JSON validation schema, perform checks, calculates the D-score, calculates Z-scores and transforms the data as a tibble with a person attribute.

read_bds(
  txt = NULL,
  format = 2L,
  schema = NULL,
  append_ddi = FALSE,
  verbose = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

txt

A JSON string, URL or file
format

Integer. JSON schema format number. There are currently two schemas supported, formats 1 and 2.
schema

A file name (including path) with the JSON validation schema. The schema argument overrides format. The function extracts the character following the string "_v" in the base name, and overwrites the format argument by the integer representation of the found character.
append_ddi

Should DDI measures be appended?
verbose

Show verbose output for centile::y2z()
...

Passed down to jsonlite::fromJSON()

Value

A tibble with 8 columns with a person attribute

See also

jsonlite::fromJSON(), centile::y2z()

Author

Stef van Buuren 2021

Examples

fn <- system.file("examples", "Laura_S.json", package = "bdsreader")
q <- read_bds(fn, format = 1)
q
